meanings.definition: To spur a horse with a rowel.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy was roweling his horse to make it go faster.
meanings.sent2: She roweled the horse gently to guide it in the right direction.
meanings.sent3: The horse seemed to enjoy the roweling, thinking it was a playful nudge.
meanings.sent4: Her words roweled him into action, like a sharp prod to his motivation.
meanings.sent5: The roweling of the horse's sides left a lasting impression on the rider.

meanings.definition: To prod or goad someone into action.
meanings.sent1: The coach kept roweling the team to give their best effort.
meanings.sent2: He roweled his friend to finally start working on his project.
meanings.sent3: Her constant roweling was like a gentle push towards success.
meanings.sent4: The urgent deadline roweled him into a frenzy of productivity.
meanings.sent5: The roweling words of encouragement spurred him on to achieve his goals.

meanings.definition: A small revolving wheel with sharp points, attached to the heel of a rider's boot for urging a horse on.
meanings.sent1: The roweling on his boots made him look like a true cowboy.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the roweling on the rider's boots.
meanings.sent3: The roweling on the boots added a touch of elegance to his outfit.
meanings.sent4: The roweling on the boots gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The roweling on the boots jingled softly as the rider approached.
